gui
Class GameBoard

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gui.GameBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
Direct Known Subclasses:
GraphBoard, TrisentisBoard
public abstract class GameBoard
extends javax.swing.JPanel

The class represents a game board of a sigma-Game. How it is presented exactly must be defined in the subclass. But this class provides general methods for different game modi.

Author:
Irene Thesing
See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

VALUE_0

public static final java.awt.Color VALUE_0
Color representing value 0 in the game.

VALUE_1

public static final java.awt.Color VALUE_1
Color representing value 1 in the game.

GAME_MODE

public static final int GAME_MODE
In the game mode, the player is allowed to do moves on every node.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

GAME_RECORD_MODE

public static final int GAME_RECORD_MODE
In the game mode, the player is allowed to do moves on every node. Aditionally there is a record panel, which shows a record of the moves.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

INPUT_MODE

public static final int INPUT_MODE
In the input mode, the player shall be allowed to give an input configuration by clicking on the nodes.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SHOW_MODE

public static final int SHOW_MODE
In the show mode, nobody shall be able to change the view of the board. It ist used for showing solutions or kernel elements.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

game

protected Game game
The game which is the base for the game board.

mode

protected int mode
Describes which mode the game board has. That is if it shall be provide playing, giving an input or no operations.

boardPanel

protected javax.swing.JComponent boardPanel
On this Panel the game board is displayed. Depending on the mode, some other panels are added.

recordPanel

protected javax.swing.JComponent recordPanel
This is the panel, where the record is shown on. It is only needed in GAME_RECORD_MODE.

inputReady

protected javax.swing.JButton inputReady
This Button is only needed in INPUT_MODE, it starts the game.

panel2

protected javax.swing.JPanel panel2
The second panel, where the record is shown on.

Constructor Detail

GameBoard

public GameBoard()
Creates a new game board with the given game. After calling this method it is necessary to call the methods initBoardPanel() and initModous(startMode) with a fitting mode to complete the creation of the game board.

Method Detail

initMode

public void initMode(int startMode)
Initializes the game board or more exactly the additional components depending on the actual mode. For example in GAME_RECORD_MODE an additional record panel is added, therefore the method initRecordPanel must be overwritten.

Parameters:
startMode - the new mode which shall be prepared.

gameRecordView

protected void gameRecordView()
Changes the view of the game board, so that it is divided into one part, where the player makes the moves and another, where the record is shown.

gameView

protected void gameView()
Changes the view of the game board such that only the game board is shown.

showView

protected void showView()
Changes the view of the game board such that only the game board is shown. No Buttons can be pressed.

inputView

protected void inputView()
Changes the view of the game board such that there is an additionally button under the game board to start the game with the input which is done.

initBoardPanel

protected abstract void initBoardPanel()
Initializes the view of the game board.

initRecordPanel

protected abstract void initRecordPanel()
Initializes the view of the record board. It is needed if GAME_RECORD_MODE is active.

initSpecialMode

protected abstract void initSpecialMode(int mode)
If the subclass has some more possible mode values, they shall be dealed with in this method. Otherwise leave the method empty or throw some exception.

Parameters:
mode - Some new mode values.

startGame

public void startGame(boolean recordActive)
Starts the game with or without record. Calls the method #startConGame to deal with the concrete game start in the subclasses.

Parameters:
recordActive - whether the game shall be recorded.

startConGame

protected abstract Game startConGame(boolean recordActive)
Starts the game with or without record - here all the things are dealt which depends on the concrete game, so dealt with in the subclasses.

Parameters:
recordActive - whether the game shall be recorded.

startInput

public void startInput()
Starts the input mode. Calls the method #startConInput to deal with the concrete game start in the subclasses.

startConInput

protected abstract void startConInput()
Here all the things are dealt which depends on the concrete game to start the input mode, so dealt with in the subclasses.

updateSituation

public abstract void updateSituation()
Updates a situation with the game configuration which is given by the actual state of the trisentis game. Updates also the record Panel if the mode is GAME_RECORD_MODE. The method is useful for GAME_MODE, GAME_RECORD_MODE or INPUT_MODE.

updateSituation

public abstract void updateSituation(boolean[] showSit)
Updates a situation with the given configuration given as a list of boolean values, numbered in an array. This method is useful to show some solutions in SHOW_MODE.

Parameters:
showSit - situation which shall be shown on the board.

getMode

public int getMode()
Returns the mode in which the game board is at the moment.

Returns:
the actual mode of the game board, such as GAME_MODE for playing,INPUT_MODE or SHOW_MODE.

getGame

public Game getGame()
Returns the game which is represented on the game board. Please only call this method if the game was started.

Returns:
the game played on the game board.
